website_summaries.verdict: While these are great shoes for occasional hiking, you may want to consider others on our list if you need a pair to wear every day with more reliable durability and fit.
pros: Built for both comfort and tackling off-road terrain
An impressive feature set includes excellent support, KEEN Dry moisture-wicking liner, waterproof nubuck upper, and sturdy lugs that grip for precise traction
cons: Not ideal for everyday wear, as the soles tend to wear out prematurely
Somewhat bulky, and sizes run on the larger side

customer_reviews.title: I really find Keen footwear comfortable as they have a wide toe box and are ...
customer_reviews.text: These hiking shoes are rugged and actually a little stylish--with the lavender accents. Although they provide firm support, I really find Keen footwear comfortable as they have a wide toe box and are contoured well around the ankle/heel. I have slightly large ankles and they don't cut in like other hiking shoes that I've tried. They are a little heavy as they are made with a very durable exterior but I can see that they will hold up for a very long time. I actually had a similar design about 15 yrs ago but my foot grew a little so I gave them to my mom. They last forever with minor care.
customer_reviews.author: deborah anderson

customer_reviews.title: Hit my ankles, bruised top of my feet
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love these, because the toe box is spacious, I love the color, the price is great, and overall they are of good construction and quality. But they go right up to my ankles, and after walking around the house with them for about a half hour to an hour, I couldn't bear them. Plus they left a bruise on the top of my foot. I tried thick wool socks, 2 pairs of socks, loosening/tightening the laces, nothing helped. They were a half size up, as a lot of reviewers suggested. My daughter noted the same ankle issue with hers. Sadly returning both.
customer_reviews.author: Tim & Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Heel Material peeling off, very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy shoe. Seemed to stretch out the more it was worn. Have updated my review. I purchased these in 2017. These are my backup shoes only worn for hiking(birding) in wet grass. I am very unhappy that the heel material is starting to peel off. See the pictures where I inserted a card below the material. For this price I would of expected these shoes to last a lot longer. I will be contacting Keen. Don't know if I can just super glue this back and if it would last when it gets wet. This is my only issue, the shoes are comfortable and waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Blue's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Out of the box comfortable!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm always skeptical about ordering shoes online. I have a wide foot and have trouble finding shoes to fit that are not wide. I wear a 71/2 wide, so I ordered an 8. These didn't disappoint. I wore them for the first time on a camping trip and they were comfortable from the start. They have a wide toe box and very roomy so my toes aren't squished. KEEN is a quality shoe, worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: SunflowerGirl

customer_reviews.title: So good she bought a 2nd pair!!
customer_reviews.text: Originally my wife purchased a pair from an REI store. They lasted 6 years before they finally needed replacing, but not because they were broken. She still wears them to work in the yard. The only reason she bought a 2nd pair was because the other didn't look nice anymore. We did find that this pair doesn't seem to have quite as high of an arch as the original pair, but overall she is very satisfied and recommends them to all of her friends. Prior to buying Keens she would get lots of ankle and calf pain when walking. Now she can walk all day on any type of flooring or ground and no pain. I'd say that's a win!
customer_reviews.author: Merk_man

customer_reviews.title: Fit perfect and not one blister after 1.5 yrs of wear
customer_reviews.text: I've never had a pair of Keen's Hiking Boots before. Thought I'd give them a try. I am sold for life. I need a wide toe spread, high toe dome. These boots had this and more. I found the heal to also fit perfectly, no slipping or odd rubbing. I have not once had a blister while wearing these boots. Yes, these boots only lasted me 1.5 yrs. But it has been a year of miles and miles of hiking (urbn and wildness). These boots and I have hiked CA, OR, WA and NV. I'll be precuring a new pair of Keen Boots for planned hike trips in 2021 for UT, NM, AZ and OR hikes.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Size does matter with all shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I just want to say that it says to buy a 1/2 size larger on the Keen site- i did and I had to send them back and get my 71/2 instead of the 8. i wear orthopedic inserts that are measured to my foot and they fit the 7.5 as needed, too big in the 8. I like the fact that i can tighten the back with the laces, as my right foot is smaller as I have a titanium big toe as i had a melted bone from overuse i guess its kinda weird when your foot doctor says i have never seen that before...lol. Fit is fantastic feels great, like slippers, what a relief..
customer_reviews.author: ShoppingMuse

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying Keens for years and always hate it when my current model wears out and I have to buy a new version. But I'm never disappointed in Keens, especially this time. These are super comfortable and nice-looking (as far as clunky hiking shoes can be,) and fit just right, even with moderately cushioned socks. I hike a lot here in Arizona and don't even want to take them off when I'm done.
customer_reviews.author: Animal lover

customer_reviews.title: Good hiking shoe for Plantar Fasciaitis.
customer_reviews.text: As an outdoorsy type with PF, I'm always looking for a durable shoe that doesn't kill my feet while I'm working. It could use a bit more cushion built in (not the insert, I use ones my podiatrist recommends), but it's far better for all day field work than any North Face, Columbia or Merrill shoe I've tried. For the record, I waited until I've worn them through three field trip cycles and machine washed once before reviewing. They seem like they should last a year or more. Nice and roomy up front for toe stretching.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra F. C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: As they say, "fool me once, shame on you, fool me twice, shame on me"! My wife bought a pair as she is very hard to fit. She is easy on shoes and I usually throw out or donate her shoes because she says they are no longer functional, although they look good. She bought these Keens at the same time I bought Merrells. The soles came undone just one month after the warranty period. We contacted Keens and they refused to honor the quality of their product. WE event sent pictures to no avail. Poor company that does not stand by their product. Please forward this review to Keens! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Marine Cajun

customer_reviews.title: Mixed Feelings
customer_reviews.text: I am trying these to replace my Merrels that I find are not waterproof despite advertising as such. These seem to fit the bill in that respect but are not comfortable like the Merrels were. The sides are high, they hit the bone one the outside of my foot (whatever that's called) and the inserts were really really uncomfortable. I took the inserts out and replaced with my Merrels and that helped significantly. They are also very ugly. On a positive note, so far they seem to be waterproof, seem well made, and the treads are really thick and sturdy so I feel safe when walking in the winter weather. I think they'll hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clean?
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I own 3 pair of similar Keen shoes. I severely broke my ankle over a year ago and am left needing orthotic inserts and a brace. Keen accepts all the extra bulk while still providing comfort. Having said that it is understandable that I already own and enjoy three pair of similar Keen shoes. My concern with this particular pair is while removing the bed of the shoes so I could insert my custom orthotics I noticed dirt debris and several strands of animal fur in each shoe as if they had been worn previously. I would suggest that the seller check out product before shipping
customer_reviews.author: Diana C.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, great looking and really durable!
customer_reviews.text: Love the color and the thick rubber toe box and heel, great for walking my dog in rain or muddy trails! This is my second pair of Keen and it won’t be the last! I always wear 8 1/2 but I got a 9 in these! I don’t like my boots tight or my toe touching the tip of the shoe. The 9 is roomy! The 8 1/2 would’ve been a perfect fit but I rather have it a little more roomy and wear thick socks so these were great! If you don’t want to wear a thick sock then go with your original size. LOVE THESE!
customer_reviews.author: Red Head Deb

customer_reviews.title: Weird fit
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted these shoes. They seem well built and sturdy, but the fit is off. I wear a 7.5 consistently. When the shoes arrived they were too big in the heal. My feet slid up with every step. So I returned them for a half size smaller. This time they were too small and my toe hit the end of the toe box. My heel still slid. No matter how tight I pulled the laces. It felt like the heel and ankle area were not secure. It wasn't meant to be.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Hanratty

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I have feet that are difficult to buy shoes for. I had surgery on my big toe to remove part of the bone because it was growing together, so I have to have shoes that provide a thick enough sole. I also have planter fasciitis, which means I need decent arch support. Keen's shoes are amazing for me! I wore them for a few hours running errands and had zero pain despite them being brand new shoes. I love them!!! Perfect for walking, standing, any problems
customer_reviews.author: Homewithkids

customer_reviews.title: WORST SHOES EVER - QUALITY HAS DECLINED
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are the least comfortable shoes I've ever experienced. They have no cushioning in the foot bed *at all* and they remind me of walking barefoot on concrete, except slightly less enjoyable. This is not what I expect from an expensive KEEN product, for which I foolishly paid $116 & change. Shortly after the arrival of these shoes, my brother died and so they sat unopened & not tried on. By the time we got through the funeral, etc., the return window had closed. KEEN refuses to stick by their bad product and will not grant me a refund. Their quality is now shoddy and I will no longer be a customer of theirs.
customer_reviews.author: le fromage vert

customer_reviews.title: Gym shoes
customer_reviews.text: I am 5’11, and due to an accident I weigh over 300 pounds. I go through shoes very quickly due to my weights and the lack of support. I bought these for the gym. And I’ve had them for six months. And I’m still using them. I work out 2 to 3 times a week doing cardio and weights and then three times a week I’m in the pool. I want to get my body back from the injury. These shoes handle the days where I am bloated and my feet are very swollen. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia

customer_reviews.title: If you like to hike
customer_reviews.text: If you like to hike...you should own a pair of KEEN shoes! These are amazing, have 2 pairs of KEEN hiking shoes/boots, purchased first pair for a 10 day hiking trip in Glacier National Park, they held up to the conditions and long all day strenuous hikes, no blisters, no sore feet. I have high arches and have tried many hiking shoes & boots such as Merrill which are nice, Northface, and several other brands but these are my go to's! They are a little heavy but offer great protection when in rocky areas, great traction as well, perfect for any rugged activity. Highly recommend these KEEN Targhee II or the KEEN Voyager Hiking Shoes.
customer_reviews.author: NicatNite

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, not the Keen I trusted
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved Keens and have multiple pairs. These are made different than all the others. The back of the shoe digs into my ankles and it is a rigid piece of plastic sticking out from inside the shoe, just awful. After a five mile hike these were destroyed and coming unstitched, plastic inside digging into my feet. My partner also has a pair, same model, also had the plastic on the heel dig into his ankles. Cheaply made!!!
customer_reviews.author: LoraX

customer_reviews.title: Poor stitching.
customer_reviews.text: I returned theses because of poor workmanship. The material near the bottom of the laces looked frayed on both sides. It wasn’t stitched well. If I’m spending over $100, I want well made shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Kaskel

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are fine. They look as nice as my last pair of KEEN's that I wore for years. They are more stiff, unfortunately. I'm hoping that the more I wear them, the more they will loosen up and get more comfortable. My last pair were not stiff at all. They were among the most comfortable shoes I'd ever worn. I wore them all the time. Now, I feel reluctant to wear these even though they fit fine and don't rub or cause blistering or anything; they are just stiff and kind of hard. I used to look forward to wearing my KEEN hiking boots. Now, I don't. I plan to update my review in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: kjs

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with the appearance
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to get these shoes as I’m going hiking in Switzerland in a few weeks. I am very disappointed with the condition they came in. The material of the shoe looked like it has already been on a hike, it’s all scuffed and scratched and the paper in the box was all crinkled as well. Everything else looks unused. Debating on sending them back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: I got this shoes for hiking in Colorado and it was great. My skin is very thin and I always have blisters, but these shoes are so comfortable that even after 11 miles on hiking, I didn’t have any blister, which surprised me. And it was the first time using them. Awesome!! I usually wear size 6-6.5. I bought 6 and fit perfectly. The waterproof wasn’t that good but Overall it worked great, I’m happy I got them and I strongly recommend those.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: A great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I had reservations about buying because I usually buy Merrell. These shoes are great! I think they may run a little big because with my thin socks they seem a little loose at the back, but I just put on regular socks and I'm good! They wore so well I wouldn't send them back to see if I needed a half size smaller. I have plantar fasciitis occasionally and since I've been wearing these shoes I have had no problems with the bottom of my foot feeling tight. The height is right on me, not too high nor too low. Good looking shoe too. I would recommend them to anybody with no reservations!!
customer_reviews.author: Darlene W

customer_reviews.title: Defective design in otherwise nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: The shoe was great out of the box. It looks nice and sturdy, and felt really good - great support and very comfortable. Unfortunately, the second or third time I wore the shoe, one of the 'eyelets' broke, thereby making it impossible to properly lace the right shoe. There's no way to fix it, so I had to return the shoes. It's outrageous that Keen designed the shoes so poorly that they broke within a couple of days. What a waste of an otherwise great pair of shoes. Buyers beware!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Mostly satisfied......
customer_reviews.text: I already have a pair of these....or at least the previous generation of these and am very pleased. I bought this pair for when my current ones die. The new ones are slightly lighter in weight than what I have do I’m guessing the overall quality is a bit decreased. But I’m glad I bought them. They fit and feel good. I hope they last as long as the ones I have
customer_reviews.author: JacksonWomanTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Nice hiking shoes but too big for women with small and narrow feet
customer_reviews.text: Pros: I love the style, quality, material, and color. Cons: I returned it because they didn't fit as expected. I am size 5 and these hiking shoes running at least 1/2 size bigger. For those with small and narrow feet these hiking shoes are too wide having too much room on your toe. Unfortunately, Keen didn't have smaller hiking shoes for women. The other option is searching the Big kids hiking shoes and I didn't find anything...
customer_reviews.author: SRoque

customer_reviews.title: Best Winter Walking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my morning walks in snow during the winter. I found out they are just a great shoe period. Great support for my high arch without any special supports added. My foot is on the wide side but there is plenty of room in the toe box and regular width for me with wool socks. I just wore out my first pair. I reordered two more because the price is the best around and I’m afraid the might be discontinued.
customer_reviews.author: boggie

customer_reviews.title: Wide heel
customer_reviews.text: Heel and toe box huge. Doesn’t run true to size
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these Keens!
customer_reviews.text: I am always leery of buying women's hikers because I wear size 11 and usually have to buy a men's shoe to fit me comfortably. I love Keens and loved the look of these shoes, so I decided to take a chance on them. I am so glad that I did!! The second I slipped my feet into the shoes, it was comfortable. I haven't taken them on a long hike yet, but on the shorter hikes, they are very comfortable. The soles are very grippy and stable. Love these shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Koepplinger

customer_reviews.title: Go up a size and wear hiking socks
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a size 10. These shoes are a size 11. (I tried a 10.5...but the toe box was tight.) The shoes are a little lose in the heel area when i walk in them. I will be wearing these when i explore Boston next month with the hopes that they’ll work when i go to Ireland next year. I am hoping that hiking socks will solve the looseness issue as soon as i buy some!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great ache support
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of these boots bc i wore out the other pairs from hiking and walking dogs. Great pair, good toe room for people with bunions and stiff arch. I use a different foot liner but these are great boots if you need arch support. Glad Keen continues to make them for people with problem feet
customer_reviews.author: PAL

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Needed a waterproof hiking shoe. Already have the high top version and it is very comfortable. Since I have hard to fit feet (need great arch support, great cushioning, wide toe box), I went with a known winner. It did not disappoint. Haven't tried in wet conditions yet.
customer_reviews.author: Agility Breeze

customer_reviews.title: Unforgiving style
customer_reviews.text: These were a little dissapointing for keen. As always the fit is as expected but the top rubs on the ankle terrible. The laces are very hard to tighten and tie because the shoe is so stiff and the tongue gathers in the middle. The tongue causes so much pressure on the top of the foot that it cuts off blood flow and makes my feet go numb. I'm thinking it will be almost impossible to endure the ankle rubbing and pressure from the gathered tongue to break these in.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina F.

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure if a 5 would fit well with heavy socks, so I also ordered a 5-1/2 . I definitely needed the larger size with heavy socks but decided I'd most likely wear thinner socks for comfort, so kept the 5's. I wore them around the house doing chores, up and down stairs, etc. to wear them in. They stayed comfortable, fit comfortably, nice wide toe box, but the laces loosened easily. I guess I'll need to double knot them when out and about. They are light weight and fit to size. Nice looking shoe, too! I have yet to see how they do in wet weather. I now own 5 pair of Keens. I obviously like this brand!
customer_reviews.author: burfee

customer_reviews.title: Replacement pair of hiking shoes for an avid hiker
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the color is amazing and dark enough that I won't care about mud (these will be trekking the white mountains of NH this year). Secondly, I've been "breaking them in" for a week...only my feet have had zero complaints, which means it may have been unnecessary. These are my second pair of Keens, and if these are anything like my first, they'll be part of the beginning of a life-long journey of customer satisfaction :)
customer_reviews.author: Kat Clark

customer_reviews.title: It's actually painful to my hands to try and tighten the laces ...
customer_reviews.text: I am not able to tighten the laces enough to make the shoe fit properly so it always feels loose across the top. There are no hooks at the end by the tongue, just holes for the laces. It's actually painful to my hands to try and tighten the laces because there is no way to get leverage and the type of lace is all wrong - it slides right through my hands. The shoe is also very heavy. It does provide enough room for a wider foot and grip is excellent but I prefer my Keen boots to this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Cheyenne Mtn Charter

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: You just can't go wrong with Keen. I have repeatedly tried to go for a more economical shoe, but I always come back to Keen. It's really worth the extra dollars. I needed help finding out which shoe model I had as I couldn't tell from the website. I sent a picture of my old shoes and they responded right away to let me know which one it was. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: FenixRyzng

customer_reviews.title: I love my Targhee II hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair---wore the first pair out after 3 years of hard use. I am not a hiker but use these shoes for sure-footed grip in uneven terrain in my pasture and woods, as well as strong stability for my feet...no foot slopping around in these shoes. Also really appreciate the waterproof feature.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Gulliver

customer_reviews.title: Good Waterproof shoe
customer_reviews.text: I've probably purchased 20 pairs of these shoes over the years. They are excellent in terms of being water proof and comfortable. The toe box area offers good protection. I walk many miles in these shoes although I wish that Keen would make the sole of the shoe so it would last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Reverberant Redbud

customer_reviews.title: I'm so glad I found the Keen hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I had been having problems with synovitis in both ankles. I decided on hiking shoes to hopefully correct the problem. I'm so glad I found the Keen hiking shoe. Since wearing them, my ankles are going back to normal. I went to reconstructive foot surgeon to get X-rays and treatment for synovitis . I showed the shoes to the doctor, and he was familiar with this hiking shoe. He told me I made an excellent choice. I'm VERY pleased with this hiking shoe, comfortable, and easy on joints.
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Worth it! The best hiking shoe I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny! I was wary at first paying what I paid for these. However I have worn these through mud, icy waters, rough terrain and my feet stayed warm and dry. Very roomy in the toe area. I did add an insole for extra comfort but these are the best hiking shoes I have ever owned! Others mentioned ordering a size up, I did at first and they were too big so I got my normal size and they fit perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: H. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I hike and walk often. They have good grip on the bottom. On slippery days, if I am going for a walk rather than running, I wear them outside rather than my running shoes. I can put on a think pair of ski socks and walk very comfortably. Toe box has plenty of room. Heel is a bit loose but I still feel secure in them. They a a bit heavy, but I like the feeling of stability. Are my new fave hiking shoes for times that I don't need boots.
customer_reviews.author: Paris skier

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, comfortable and good tread!
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite pair of hiking shoes! I wear a size 7 open toe, and 7.5 in athletic shoes - I got the 7.5 in these and they're a perfect fit with medium weight socks. The first few times I hiked with them I had a couple of hot spots, but they're comfortable now. Super light weight, great tread and I've worn them in the rain and stayed dry. The only criticism I have is that the laces are hard on fingers while tightening, and don't stay tied unless you switch directions when lacing (left over right, then knot right over left).
customer_reviews.author: PublicName

customer_reviews.title: Reliable quality
customer_reviews.text: I always buy this style. Reliable, waterproof and durable. Short break in period. I like this color comination.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Johnson

customer_reviews.title: My toes are happy
customer_reviews.text: I bought an expensive pair of boots, they were slippery as heck, I never took them back, my loss. I really like toe space, good grip in the snow, comfortable. These fit all the bills for me. I only wish they were in half sizes. I bought an 8 so I can wear heavy socks. They are comfortable, my toes have plenty of room, they have a nice grip to them. I would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: BeMa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent item
customer_reviews.text: Loved these took them with me to Scotland and they held up against the weather . Would certainly purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Genna

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as my other pair of keens
customer_reviews.text: These were great, but I got them wet at work and they started stinking of mold. I've tried to get it to go away but I think I'm going to give up. It's weird because I've got a second pair of keens that are similar but a different model and I wear them the same way and they've never caused the same problem. But they are wearing out in the heels which is why I got this pair. Also, the sole in these started to peel where the points wrap up from the bottom. Annoying.
customer_reviews.author: RainK

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe they don't run small!
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoes. I've had this style before. I normally wear a 6 1/2 and ordered a 7 due to other reviews. I should have stuck with the smaller size. Luckily I can tighten the laces. Nice wide toe box, love the toe bumper. I'm a nurse and wear these for 16 hours a day. Comfy!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and durable!
customer_reviews.text: Keen shoes are so comfortable and have such a consistent fit that I quickly forget I’m wearing a new pair. They’re perfect right out of the box - no need to break them in before wearing all day or going hiking. They’re also so durable! This is my fourth pair and my first pair, bought 10 years ago, were only retired to yard work-wear status last year. Highly satisfied customer!
customer_reviews.author: VL

customer_reviews.title: This is my 3rd pair of Keen shoes because I love their shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I can always count on Keen shoes fitting my size 7 foot, like a glove, right out of the box! Very comfortable, I appreciate the color selection (not just pinks and purples, for a woman) and they are a great shoe or boot for the hiking trail. I will continue to buy Keen shoes because of these reasons.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Tyson

customer_reviews.title: Has been a comfortable , solid hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: Have always bought Merrills but I thought I would give the Keens a try. Very comfortable and sturdy hiking shoe. It’s a little stiffer than my Merrill’s but broke in nicely. Feet feel well protected on gravel and rockier terrain. I normally wear a 10 and these were true to size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for long hikes
customer_reviews.text: I hike/trail run a LOT and this is my go to shoe. I have a wider foot so the toe box works well for me. I do not find this shoe to be super supportive for steep downhill runs but this is not what the shoe was made for. However... this shoe provides impressive traction when moving down hill at fast speeds over really greasy rocks and dirt.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Tugman

customer_reviews.title: Ladies KEEN Hikers ROCK!!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised when I received these hiking shoes because I'm not the easiest to fit into shoes because I have small but wide width feet. The minute I stepped foot in them, I was in awe at their comfort. They roomy toe box was exactly what I was looking for. I didn't even have to insert my orthotic inserts; the arch was plenty. Will order again when I need to.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not usual Keen quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm sad to say this pair of Keens was shoddily constructed with places near the base of the tongue where the the internal padding was sticking through the stitching and other spots where the periwinkle trim just flat out had holes where the white padding could be seen. I love this brand and usually am five star head over heels in love with every new pair but this was just bad construction quality and certainly not worthy of a pair of shoes that I was paying $124 for. I returned them for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: shoe schwinn

customer_reviews.title: Lose fitting
customer_reviews.text: Unlike most Keens these aren't ghastly to look at. The laces are pretty much impossible to tighten up so the shoes are always sort of lose on your feet and easy to slip out of. I bought these to travel through Scotland, but I definitely need some insoles to be able to stand in these all day.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Lee

customer_reviews.title: Lovely light hikers
customer_reviews.text: If you like Keens, you'll love these. They are so comfortable, I forget I'm wearing them. Nice traction, good for light hiking, though I don't think they provide enough support if you're backpacking. I wear mine every day and another plus is that the footbed comes out so you can throw it in the washer. I always find that Keens run a little large and wide -- and I have average feet -- so I always size down by 1/2 size, w one pair of socks (like the thin Smartwools). If you want to wear thick socks don't size down.
customer_reviews.author: artistclare

customer_reviews.title: Decent shoes
customer_reviews.text: I like these shoes so far. My first day wearing them my feet hurt, but I think these shoes need to be broken in first. My shoes felt like they were a little bigger than what they should be. In the heel area it didn’t feel tight like my other shoes. The second time I word these shoes for a long time my feet did t hurt as bad. I like these for hiking and working out.
customer_reviews.author: Roswav11

customer_reviews.title: Used Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have had these shoes for a few weeks. Upon receipt I tried them in my house, on carpet, and they fit. Then put them in back in the box until I needed them. Got them out to take on a camping trip and upon closer inspection, found that they actually are used - dust in the soles and small debris in the tread. I am returning. Although they were a good deal, I could have spent way less if I wanted to buy used shoes!
customer_reviews.author: MBD

customer_reviews.title: High quality shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. Love the quality. Love the look/color. These will last me many, many years. I normally wear a 6 and ordered 6 1/2 as recommended by reviews and glad I did. If you are thinking about purchasing these I highly recommend it. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela L Rangel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I purchased size 8 and 8 1/2. One was too small the other too big. Kept the 8 1/2's but wish I could return them now. The upper part of the shoe digs into the side of my foot by my ankle making them impossible to wear. Won't buy keens from amazon again. window of return is closed and now I can't get my money back. I'll stick with the Keen website
customer_reviews.author: dkcharms

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but needed repair
customer_reviews.text: I liked my high-top Targhees so much for hiking that I got these low ones to use as sneakers. One of the treads came unglued immediately. I glued it back on and it's fine; hopefully it was a fluke.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Probably a good hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: Probably a good hiking shoe, but I was looking for an all-day type shoe. I bought KEEN because my brother recommended them, his pair of work boots have the flexibility of a sports shoe but they're sturdy, unlike the sports shoes I had to buy because of tendonitis and whatnot. I hate sports shoes because they wear out too quickly with my all-day wear and tear. These were too heavy, with no flexibility; however, they were super comfy and very beautiful. Wish I could have kept them.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Weinell

customer_reviews.title: Decent shoe, just wish for some different features
customer_reviews.text: I think these are a great shoe, but they fit a little big. I usually wear a size 8 in just about any shoe, but I should have gotten a 7.5 with these. I don't think they have very good support either, but that could just be my own feet (I have very high arches and it's hard to find anything that will support them well). And for a hiking shoe, they don't have very good traction. I can't tell you how many times I've slipped on wet spots. All of that being said, I think they are a good quality shoe. Just with some flaws.
customer_reviews.author: Kate B.

customer_reviews.title: Love These Shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are not only great for hiking, but they can be worn in just about any situation, including standing on your feet for hours on end. This was my first pair of hiking shoes and I was a little skeptical buying them online without trying them on. My purchase was based on prior reviews, most of which were very positive. I do wear thick socks in the winter and these shoes fit perfectly. I plan to buy another pair for the summer and will probably buy a half a size smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Patterson

customer_reviews.title: too loose in the ankle
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I cant really wear this style because unlike all my other Keens, the top of the laces, comes nowhere near my ankle, allowing my too much movement and a loose feeling where your foot enters the shoe
customer_reviews.author: Kristin R

customer_reviews.title: Been needing a pair of hiking boots and was super excited when I saw these
customer_reviews.text: Been needing a pair of hiking boots and was super excited when I saw these. However upon receiving them they were way too small. I usually wear a 7, 7.5 in any pair of shoes and ordered the 7.5 to be on the safe side and these were just too small. My toes were super scrunched and had to send it back. I would say if you are going to order these order two sizes up of what you usually wear. Other than having to play with the sizing, these are a great pair of hiking boots
customer_reviews.author: skyylab

customer_reviews.title: Arch on OUTSIDE of foot too high,  Needs more on actual arch of the foot less on outside
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is great for wet weather. love the width which is wider than most even at medium with. But the arch on the outside of the foot is just plain rediculas. Feet have an arch on the mid inside NOT ON THE OUTSIDE!!! Used to love the Keen shoe but now the arch on the outside of the foot is simply WRONG
customer_reviews.author: Sidnie L. Zari

customer_reviews.title: Are these really Keens???
customer_reviews.text: I currently own 2 other pairs of Keen shoes both of which are extremely comfortable (and an old pair of Keen trail running shoes were the best I ever had!). These are so stiff and uncomfortable, it's hard to believe they're really Keens. Not sure what's going on but these are terrible. Buy another style and skip these altogether. Total disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: S.E.F.

customer_reviews.title: Runs a half size small.  They're are quite roomy for the toes ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 6.5 and ordered a 6.5.. it was a half size too small. I measured it against my current shoe and it was significantly shorter. Returned and got a 7. Perfect fit. They're are quite roomy for the toes and even having a bunion toe spacer inside. Very comfortable for hiking, although, they aren't great for climbing rocks... kinda stiff and the grip isn't the greatest. Love them, but was hoping for a better grip overall, for tougher hikes.
customer_reviews.author: Lilah

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! They are sturdy, durable, waterproof, and very cute!!!! Lol I wear them when I am hiking or just running errands. My balance is improved, and my back isn't in as much pain. Truth!! I tried a different style my first time, but had to send them back. I ordered these and they fit wonderfully. I definitely recommend trying these. I couldn't be happier with the pair I have. **These have improved my balance. I tripped on some stairs at a concert, in the dark the other night and went skeetering down 4 short stairs. I stayed on my feet! I was amazed. Lol.
customer_reviews.author: Jaxxonsue13

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as the boots!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough about these shoes. I have the mid-boots and they are one of the most comfortable shoes I have worn. These shoes are the same. Keen's run big in the toebox so know that when you order. The idea that they are waterproof proves perfect for New England winter weather which can be messy and sloppy. The shoe itself feel like a sneaker and keeps you warm. I am looking forward to wearing them on warm day hikes as well as general daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy W

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable right out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: Felt perfect right out of the box! I tried 5 other hiking shoes prior to these Targhees, and none were a comfortable as these! I will be wearing them in Ireland for over a week, so I am hoping that they serve me well in the rain!
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: The first pair fit great. As comfortable as wearing bedroom slippers
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Keen Targhee II's. The first pair fit great. As comfortable as wearing bedroom slippers. Unfortunately, the sole fell apart in one spot so I purchased a second pair, in Mineral. These shoes don't fit near as nice as the first pair, not as comfortable. I like the extra room at the toe of both pairs. I'm not certain if both pairs were seconds or if Keen shoes are inconsistent in their manufacturing.
customer_reviews.author: sleighnice

customer_reviews.title: beautiful shoe, great width but cut in below ankle bone
customer_reviews.text: Love this shoe and the width is awesome for my feet BUT the outer sides cut in just below my ankle bone. After wearing them around the living room for a couple of hours, I could predict blisters when hiking. I had to return them....sadly.
customer_reviews.author: barbara

customer_reviews.title: Terrific support, bulkier shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and compared with the Merrell All Out Blaze hiking shoe. There really is no comparison, they are Very different shoes. I wanted to love the Keen, and I truly loved the feel/fit. They are well cushioned and had terrific arch support. Excellent waterproofed leather, seams were well sewn and the bottom grip fantastic. I did end up returning these - I couldn't get past was how bulky the shoe is, if you're good with that, you'll likely love these. The sizing was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: ReverenceAcres

customer_reviews.title: Super solid and amazing support in this shoe. Well worth the cost!
customer_reviews.text: My garden is uneven and I felt like I was going to fall wearing regular shoes. I got these because they are so supportive and my foot won't twist in them. They feel a little like ski boots.
customer_reviews.author: Westerner

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase ~
customer_reviews.text: I am definitely a size 8 and these shoes fit my feet perfectly but please know I don't like much extra room in the front, I would be tripping, but I do need width as I have Morton Neuroma...I put them on with one of those smart wool socks, it worked just fine so I expect to be comfortably in any weather.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Took 2 orders
customer_reviews.text: The first pair of KEEN Women's Targhee II Hiking Shoe were definite "2nds", and should never have passed quality-control. Returned and reordered. The second pair were perfect. Appreciate the customer service of Amazon--hopefully they sent the '2nds' back to manufacturer!!
customer_reviews.author: JTD

customer_reviews.title: love my keen's
customer_reviews.text: Great hiking boots. the traction on these things and the support they give is like none other. My only small complaint is the plastic guard around the toe.... that is what tends to come apart (held by glue only). wish Keen would find a better way to do this.
customer_reviews.author: RMW

customer_reviews.title: Size Up
customer_reviews.text: My normal shoe size is 6.5 but my last hiking boots, size 7, were a little short so I ordered a size 7.5 Keen hiking shoe. The size 7.5 Keen fit the same as the size 7 boots I replaced so I returned the firs pair and got a size 8 which fits properly. The day after receiving them I wore the new Keen hiking shoes to a full day outdoor event. As others have reported, this shoe was comfortable right out of the box. The Keen shoe is very well constructed of quality materials and should serve well for some years.
customer_reviews.author: N Thomas

customer_reviews.title: My favorite sneaker
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite sneaker by Keen . I'm outside in all kinds of weather for work and this is a good waterproof shoe. I just wish the tongue was longer on either side. It has a tendency to come out and loosen the laces so i'm constantly tightening the laces back up. But all in all i love this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: mail carrier

customer_reviews.title: Terrific all-terrain shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing these shoes for six months now and they are as good, perhaps even better, as new. Sturdy through all weather, attractive and light enough to wear for day/neighborhood use and sturdy enough to get me up large mountains. If you're going to buy one shoe this one is it. The only downside is that the waterproofing makes them a bit warm, so they probably would be less great if you're in the tropics, but for other climes, they're perfect.
customer_reviews.author: M.A.

customer_reviews.title: Roomy Shoes!  Order your regular shoe size.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a half size bigger than my usual size. But these are roomy shoes and I should’ve just ordered my usual shoe size! Returning to replace with th correct size..love the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: BookWoman

customer_reviews.title: I really like these !
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace a pair of LL Bean all-weather shoes which are getting a bit long in the tooth. These new ones will be used as walking and light-hiking shoes, plus winter shoes for when it's slushy or there's some snow--but less than six inches' worth. There was NO break-in period with these ! In fact their design seems to make walking easier and more enjoyable. I got these when the worst of winter here in Iowa was over--I'm knocking on wood as I write that--they look like they'll have good traction for everything but on wet ice. For THAT there's porta-spikes !
customer_reviews.author: Kayt Rivermoon

customer_reviews.title: My wife like it
customer_reviews.text: My wife wear this for several international trips (many walking) and feel comfortable and sturdy with the shoe. The size ordered is what she wants and fit well. Keen is a good brand.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Great product amazing price!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my daughter because I wear Keen brand shoes/boots for work so I know the quality is good. She wanted some hiking shoes so I went with these and she loves them. These same exact shoes at the store were over $40 more than Amazon so I'm extremely happy with my purchase! I would definitely recommend these to anyone!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Brown

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit right
customer_reviews.text: I wanted these boots so badly, but they just didn't fit right. I normally wear a 7.5; it was too large and the 7 was too small. Also, the back, where it hits the heel, was too high for my foot and would have caused problems later. I tried using a thin heel lifter, but it wasn't comfy enough for me to keep them. At the end of the day, I decided I didn't need something this rugged and went with the Keen Versatrail, size 7, which I absolutely love
customer_reviews.author: Fedora99

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Going hiking next week in the Galapagos. Weight for small local airlines made me look for new, short hiking shoes. I bought a half size up because I wear two pairs of socks for hiking.Been wearing them to break them in; they don’t need breaking in. Comfortable from the first day
customer_reviews.author: Jane Chicagowalker

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes of all time
customer_reviews.text: These are the best shoes I've ever owned. Great for everyday use as well as trail hiking. Second pair I've had so far, very pleased. My foot is generally a 7.5-8 depending on the shoe and the sock thickness. If I wear thinner socks with these they are a bit loose, so I'd say, for me, they run large, but with wool socks they fit well. My partner has wider feet than me and they would probably fit her snugly, so when considering this product, think about your own feet since my review is in context of my foot size :).
customer_reviews.author: K C

customer_reviews.title: Great boots.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a size up I normally wear a 9, and got this in a 9.5, I could have gone with my regular size and be fine with the thick socks. I wore this during a trip to Nepal, straight for 10 days, hiking, walking around the city, and my feet were great. I did wear them while it poured and we were doing a hike and my feet did not get wet. It was also warm a couple of days and my feet were not overly hot. I am extremely happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gabbie

customer_reviews.title: Fits and wears like snowboard boots
customer_reviews.text: These seem a bit clunkier than the sandal Keens and other sneakers I have. Not sure why. They are a bit stiff, so it's not like you can really tighten up laces to bring them in a bit more. I got this pair because my black flat sketchers gave me really bad heel pain and I needed darker shoes to go with black cargo/med pants. These will have to do. Won't be wearing them with shorts or they will look a little funny.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I always wear sneakers. The kind I wear have changed style and cheapened. My husband loves 2 styles of keens that he has, so I decided to invest. They are kind of a cross between a sneakers and a boot. They feel like a sneakers on the inside. A bit stiff and sturdy like a boot.
customer_reviews.author: Purrwoof

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Used the hiking shoes for two hikes (mountains in Arizona and Oregon) approximately 8 miles each hike. The last hike this November 2018 ended up in the five toes with major blisters. Will try an sell as they are uncomfortable. May try a different brand. Definitely waterproof but not comfortable for mountain hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Amy P.

customer_reviews.title: I love Keen shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love Keen shoes, these replaced a pair of Keen's I wore out. I normally wear an 8.5 but read reviews and ordered a 9 just in case (with free returns wasn't worried). they are slightly big in toe area but knew I could put on heavier socks and that worked. Love the colors, goes with jeans or khaki's and I'm and down a lot at work so wanted comfort. They are a little heavy compared to "normal" shoes but I'm used to them because have worn for years.
customer_reviews.author: amazon user

customer_reviews.title: loves these!
customer_reviews.text: True comfort from the first time i put them on - true to size. I will buy again, when needed! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great arch support, warm and waterproof. Awesome hiking shoe!
customer_reviews.text: These keen hiking shoes were just the ticket for our rough northern Michigan winters. It gets pretty cold and wet up here and these keens are just what I needed for hiking snowy trails. These shoes provide plenty of warmth, have good width (not narrow fitting), are truly waterproof and have excellent arch support. Very happy with this purchase. They do NOT run small, so don’t order a size up.
customer_reviews.author: tamfram

customer_reviews.title: I have problems with my feet that make it difficult finding comfortable shoes but with these Keens this granny was able ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a trip to Europe with my son and his family. I have problems with my feet that make it difficult finding comfortable shoes but with these Keens this granny was able to keep up with the 10 plus miles of walking we did every day. The other thing great about them was how good they look after the trip. Lots of rain, snow, swampy areas and rocky trails and they still look almost new.
customer_reviews.author: Eva M Chappell

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. I like the keens because the toe box tends to be wider than other shoes. Comfortable when you are on your feet for long periods as well
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Muller

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Warm but Fit too Large
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these shoes since they had great reviews and were inexpensive compared to others like these. The problem I have is with the fit. I ordered my normal size, and then exchanged them for a smaller size, and they still were too loose. I wore them a few times with thick socks, and it helped for a few hours of wear, but they started to slip again. I am not sure if it is my feet or what! They are also heavy shoes, but they should be very durable for hiking and weather.
customer_reviews.author: Zil Mallek

product_meta.title: KEEN Women's Targhee II Hiking Shoe
product_meta.description:
Targhee II Trail Shoe Available in shoe and boot styles, Keen Women's Targhee II is the ideal hiking partner. The rugged Targhee II gives you the comfort and support of an athletic shoe and the resilience and protective features of a rough-and-tough hiking boot. This style keeps your feet dry and your step steady thanks to a waterproof nubuck upper, 4-millimeter multi-directional lugs, and a Keen.Dry waterproof membrane. And for exceptional support mile after mile, the Targhee II combines an S3 heel structure with a dual-density, compression-molded EVA midsole and a Keen Metatomical EVA footbed.

Features * Sporty lace-up shoe with waterproof upper
 * EVA midsole and removable footbed for exceptional support
 * S3 heel support prevents ankle injuries
 * Keen.Dry liner wicks away moisture
 * Multi-directional lugs for dependable traction

Specs * Weight: 13.74 oz/390.22 g
 * Upper: Nubuck and textile upper
 * Lining: KEEN.DRY waterproof membrane

 Waterproof membrane offers an additional barrier against moisture.
View larger.

 S3 heel supports the foot on impact.
View larger.

RUGGED STYLE WITH A WATERPROOF NUBUCK UPPER
 The Targhee II offers a sleek-and-sporty style and a lace-up front for a custom fit. This low-profile shoe stands up to any trail conditions and looks good doing it, thanks to a durable, waterproof nubuck upper with stitching accents and pops of bright color on the laces and around the heel.

BREATHABLE MOISTURE PROTECTION WITH KEEN.DRY
 To keep you treading comfortably on all kinds of terrain, the Targhee II features a Keen.Dry insert. This waterproof membrane offers an additional barrier against moisture yet is breathable enough for all-day comfort.

S3 HEEL SUPPORT
 S3 stands for Shock, Suspension, and Stability and refers to Keen's unique heel-support structure. S3 is engineered to support the foot on impact, which dissipates shock, helping to prevent injury to the ankle.

KEEN METATOMICAL FOOTBED AND EVA MIDSOLE FOR SUPPORT
 For comfort and support that won't quit, the Targhee II features a removable, dual-density EVA footbed that provides arch support by hugging the natural contours of your foot. The compression-molded EVA midsole extends the benefits of the footbed and adds an extra spring to your step.

ESS SHANK REDUCES FOOT FATIGUE
 To keep you going longer, the Targhee II has a torsional-stability ESS shank in the midsole. This shank helps to stabilize your foot as you move, minimizing fatigue, so you can enjoy every moment as you push on to the next crest.

MULTI-DIRECTIONAL LUGS FOR GREATER TRACTION
 To give you a steady grip on all kinds of terrain, the Targhee has 4-millimeter, multi-directional lugs on its non-marking rubber outsole. These lugs are spaced wide apart to "bite" into the terrain, giving you more dependable traction on slippery and uneven surfaces.

PATENTED TOE PROTECTION
 Because rocky objects and debris can trip you up on the trail, the Targhee II includes Keen.Protect, patented toe protection that wraps up and over the outsole for thorough coverage of the entire toe bed.

KEEN: A STORY OF HYBRID INNOVATION
 Keen began in 2003 with an inspired sandal design that combined comfort and toe protection. This radical design departure for sandals spawned the overriding Keen philosophy of hybrid innovation--striving to create new possibilities and to discover and implement original ideas.

 Keen products put an emphasis on the joys of play. At the same time, Keen believes in the value of working hard to give back to the community. To that end, the company has partnered with non-profit organizations around the world to help get youth into the outdoors, protect land for its environmental and recreational value, and to give bikes to kids in need.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
 Keen Women's Targhee II Waterproof Trail Shoe.



From beaches to mountains to city streets, Keen believes the outdoors is anyplace without a ceiling. Keen believes in living a HybridLife, which means being part of a greater community that is full of people who create possibilities, play in the outdoors and care for the world around them.
feature_bullets: WATERPROOF: KEEN.DRY a waterproof, breathable membrane lets vapor out without letting water in; Durable waterproof protection stands up to wet weather and lug outsole adds traction
FIT & DESIGN: Built on a women-specific foot form; Non-removable EVA footbed with added arch support for all-day comfort

TRACTION: TRACTION: KEEN ALL-TERRAIN rubber outsole provides high-traction grip in muddy environments and on rocky surfaces; Non-marking rubber outsoles leaves no trace or imprints when walking indoors

SUPPORT & COMFORT: External stability shank offers lightweight support for improved mobility and torsion control; Cushioned collar reduces irritation and discomfort around ankle; Mesh lining helps keep feet cool in warmer environments

CARE TIPS: We've selected leather uppers designed to last; To treat day to day wear and tear, especially on lighter color leathers, we recommend using a leather cleaner and conditioner, can be found at footwear dealers or repair shop
